intro: Ernestia glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular ernestia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its structure includes stipules and a distinctive, glandular appearance on its stems and leaves. Ernestia glandulosa is often found in scrublands and canyons, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
